TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant served in ORG ( hereinafter the “ ORG ” ) and retired from service in DATE . His military pension was assessed according to his rank and DATE of service and was paid from ORG in GPE . The payments terminated in DATE , following the dissolution of ORG .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL separate proceedings subsequently dealt with the decrease of the applicant ’s military pension .

CARDINAL . Firstly , on DATE , ORG , ORG , assessed the applicant ’s pension , as from DATE , to PERCENT of the amount he had received until DATE . The applicant appealed against that decision and , after his appeal was dismissed , instituted administrative proceedings with ORG ( Upravni sud PERSON ) which dismissed the applicant ’s claim on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint claiming that the decisions of the administrative bodies and ORG to decrease the amount of his pension violated his constitutional rights . He alleged specifically that the decision to decrease his military pension was not based on legal grounds .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) dismissed the applicant ’s constitutional complaint concerning the lower bodies’ decisions to reduce his pension . It stated that these decisions were based on the laws that prescribed that the pensions of the former ORG officers would be assessed in the amount of CARDINAL MONEY of what they had received in DATE .

CARDINAL . Secondly , on DATE , the applicant lodged a constitutional claim challenging the constitutionality of the Decree regulating the pension rights of the former ORG officers whose service in the ORG terminated prior to DATE ( ORG o ostvarivanju prava iz mirovniskog i invalidskog osiguranja osoba kojima je prestalo svojstvo aktivne vojne osobe u bivšoj JNA do CARDINAL . prosinca DATE - ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . He alleged specifically that his constitutional rights were violated insofar as his pension had been drastically decreased .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG passed the LAW on regulation of pensions of the former ORG officers that , inter alia , reiterated that the amount of the former ORG pensions was to be CARDINAL,CARDINAL % of what they had received in DATE ( Zakon o ostvarivanju prava iz mirovinskog i invalidskog osiguranja pripadnika bivše ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the proceedings concerning the applicant ’s constitutional claim of CARDINAL DATE due to the fact that the above legislation had entered into force .
CARDINAL . Thirdly , on DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint against the LAW of DATE , challenging the constitutionality of that LAW as a whole .
CARDINAL . As of DATE new legislation entered into force regulating the pension rights of all NORP citizens ( Zakon o mirovinskom osiguranju – Official PERSON DATE ) .
CARDINAL . Consequently , on DATE ORG terminated the proceedings regarding the applicant ’s constitutional claim of DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the DATE LAW read as follows :
“ Every person has a right to institute proceedings challenging the constitutionality of the laws ... ”
“ Each person whose rights have been violated by a decision based on the legislation declared unconstitutional or unlawful may ask the body that took the decision to vary it ... ”

“ The Constitutional Court shall terminate proceedings concerning the constitutionality of legislation that has been repealed or brought into line with the LAW and statute law while those proceedings are pending before ORG . ”

“ Every person , who considers that any of his constitutional right has been violated by a decision of judicial or administrative body or any other body invested with public authority , may lodge a constitutional complaint with ORG . ”
“ By a decision adopting a constitutional complaint the Constitutional Court quashes the contested decision and remits a case for re - trial . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the DATE LAW read as follows :

“ The Constitutional Court shall decide upon the constitutionality of the contested legislation even in cases where that legislation is repealed or amended while the proceedings are pending before ORG . ”

“ When ORG declares the legislation contemplated in LAW unconstitutional or unlawful , each person whose rights have been violated by a decision based on that legislation may ask the body that took the decision to vary it . ”
